catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 75
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: collection of twenty images from the Tale of Genji painted in full color; primarily images of men and women inside small tatami rooms overlooking verandahs and small courtyards; clouds colored with gold leaf obscure trees and rivers
medium: Album with 20 leaves; ink, color, and gold on paper
text: This album includes 20 scenes from The Tale of Genji, but not in order. The scene at right is one of the most frequently illustrated scenes from chapter 3, in which two young women and a young boy are shown indoors playing a board game by lamplight, while Genji himself spies on them from the veranda. Genji is in pursuit of one of these girls, Utsusemi, who ends up running away after catching the scent of Genji’s perfume on the breeze. His pursuit halted in this way, Genji instead has sex with Utsusemi’s companion.
title: Album with scenes from The Tale of Genji
